narratives: Your ankle rolls on uneven ground. It swells before you can unlace your boot.
A misstep on loose stone. Your ankle buckles. You'll be limping for days.
The ground gives way. Your ankle twists wrong. It throbs with every step.
Something catches you in the ribs. Every breath is a reminder.
A blow to your side. Nothing broken, but the bruising runs deep.
Your ribs ache where you took the hit. Moving hurts. Breathing hurts.
Steel opens your forearm from elbow to wrist. Blood soaks your sleeve.
A blade catches your arm. The cut is deep but clean. You bind it tight.
Your arm bleeds freely from a jagged wound. You tie cloth around it and keep moving.
You hear the crack before you feel it. Something inside snaps. Each breath is agony.
A blow lands true. Your rib gives way with a wet grinding sound.
Sharp pain lances through your side. At least one rib is broken. You push on.
Blood streams down your face. Head wounds bleed heavy. You wipe your eyes and fight on.
Something strikes your temple hard. The world spins. Blood fills your eye.
Your head rings like a struck bell. Warm blood mats your hair.
Your arm snaps with a sickening crack. Useless now. It hangs at your side.
Bone breaks through skin. Your sword arm is shattered.
The impact shatters your forearm. You cradle it against your chest and stagger back.
Steel finds your belly. You press your hands against the wound. Blood seeps between your fingers.
You take iron in the gut. Pain like fire. Someone hauls you back from the line.
A blade slips under your guard. The wound is deep. You need the surgeon.
Your head strikes something hard. Everything goes black. When you wake, the world won't stop spinning.
A crushing blow to the skull. You can't stand straight. Your vision swims.
The ground rushes up to meet you. Someone drags you clear. You can't remember your name.
Your knee buckles. Something tears inside. You can barely put weight on it.
The joint gives way. Your knee swells before you can unlace your greave.
Pain shoots through your knee with every step. You'll be slower for a while.
Your shoulder wrenches from its socket. The arm hangs wrong. Useless until it's set.
Something pops in your shoulder. The pain is blinding. You can't lift the arm.
A twist and a pull. Your shoulder tears free with a wet grinding sound.
Steel slides between your ribs. Something inside collapses. Each breath bubbles with blood.
You're run through the chest. Breathing becomes a struggle. Pink foam on your lips.
The blade finds your lung. You cough up frothy red blood. Someone carries you to the surgeon.
Blood pulses from the wound in hot spurts. Your heartbeat measured in crimson jets.
The blade finds an artery. Blood sprays with each heartbeat. Someone binds it tight.
You're bleeding out. Fast. A comrade's belt becomes a tourniquet. It saves your life.
A blade opens your thigh. Not deep enough to cripple, but you'll be slower.
Steel scores your leg from hip to knee. Blood runs into your boot.
Your leg takes a cut. You bind it with a torn sleeve and limp on.
Your hand is caught between steel and stone. Something crunches. Two fingers don't bend right.
A blow lands on your sword hand. The bones shift wrong. Gripping anything is agony.
Your hand takes a crushing blow. You can't make a fist. Holding a weapon is torture.
Your helm saves your life, but the blow still cracks bone. Blood leaks from your ear.
Something smashes your head. Your skull fractures. The world goes white, then red, then black.
A mace catches your temple. The bone gives. You collapse. When you wake, you can't hear from one ear.
